alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 04 at 4:10AM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A Winter Weather Advisory, for periods of moderate snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow and significant blowing snow are possible. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 25 inches are possible with isolated higher amounts to around 30 inches in the Teton Range. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Salt River and Wyoming Ranges and Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains. * WHEN...The Winter Weather Advisory is through 11 AM this morning. The Winter Storm Watch is in effect from 11 PM tonight to 5 PM Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Visibility could be down to a tenth of a mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor JHAVALANCHE.ORG for the avalanche risk across western Wyoming.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, water, and a charger for your cell phone in case of an emergency. Call 5 1 1, to get the latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
